alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 12:22PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Bath and Fleming Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brooksville to 6 miles west of Fairview to 8 miles west of Carlisle. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fairview around 1235 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cowan, Nepton, Elizaville, Flemingsburg, Craintown, Pecks Ridge, Tilton, Sherburne, Poplar Plains, Mount Carmel, Pebble, Foxport, Wallingford, Oakley, Goddard, Hillsboro, Wyoming and Grange City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
